column8: The game is relaxing and enjoyable, perfect for those who love interior design and decorating.
column9: The snapping and placement mechanics are frustrating and inaccurate.

column8: The game has a lot of potential and is expected to improve with future updates.
column9: The game has numerous bugs and crashes frequently.

column8: There are some bugs and optimization issues, but they are manageable and expected in early access.
column9: The game is not optimized well, leading to performance issues.

column8: The game offers a variety of customization options for furniture and room design.
column9: There is a lack of customization options for furniture and room dimensions.

column8: The story mode includes interesting puzzles and tasks that keep the gameplay fresh.
column9: The controls and user interface are not intuitive or user-friendly.

column8: The sandbox mode allows for creative freedom and extensive customization.
column9: The game feels incomplete and lacks content.

column8: The graphics and lighting are aesthetically pleasing and add to the overall experience.
column9: The story mode and mini-games are not engaging or fun.

column8: The game is compared favorably to other interior design games like The Sims and House Flipper.
column9: The game is not suitable for realistic room planning due to restrictive mechanics.

column8: Players appreciate the ability to mod and the potential for future content through updates.
column9: The graphics and visual design are not appealing to many players.

column8: Some players have experienced issues with controls and UI, but overall find the game intuitive and fun.
column9: The game has potential but needs significant updates and improvements.

column8: Я люблю серию движков Rpg Maker, сам делаю на нем сейчас свою первую игру. Данная с позволения сказать игра сделана на нем. Вот только сюжет в ней отсутствует (а это абсолютно непростительно для жрпг), геймплей не проработан, баланс отсутствует как таковой, что делать куда идти - непонятно. Брать не советую даже по скидке. У игры и так было всего 14% положительных отзывов, теперь будет ещё меньше в процентном соотношении
column9: I love the RPG Maker series of engines; I'm currently making my first game with it. This game, so to speak, was made with it. However, it lacks a story (which is absolutely unforgivable for a JRPG), the gameplay is poorly developed, the balance is nonexistent, and it's unclear what to do or where to go. I wouldn't recommend picking it up, even on sale. The game already had only 14% positive reviews, and now it'll be even lower.

column8:
보1지고 자시고 사지마라.
DLC받으면 19금이 된다고 해서 690원주고 샀는데 돈 아까워 미치겠음.

처음 게임 시작할 때 나오는 메인메뉴 여자만 옷 벗어서 꼭1지 보여주고, 보1지는 살로 덮혀있음.
그거 외에는 달라지는게 전혀 없더라.

그리고 게임성도 개판임.
내가 이거 게임 시작하니까 아무런 설명없이 그냥 맵 한가운데 던져둠....
뭔가 말을 거는것도 없고 그냥 던져놓고 끝.

덕분에 내가 여기저기 돌아다니다가 이게 조옷망 게임인걸 판단하고 게임을 종료하고, 게임을 분해해서 확인해봤더니
야한거 없더라. 위에 적은 그 CG 1장이 끝임.


[h1]절대 사지마라. 사기당한건 나 하나면 족하다.[/h1]
column9:
Don't buy it even if you're a 18+ user.
I paid 690 won for it because they said the DLC would make it rated R, but I'm going crazy over the waste of money.

On the main menu screen when you first start the game, only the girl takes off her clothes and shows off her pussy, and her pussy is covered in flesh.
Aside from that, nothing else changes.

And the gameplay is a mess.
I started playing it, and they just threw it in the middle of the map without any explanation...

They didn't even talk to me, they just threw it there and that's it.

Thanks to that, I wandered around and realized this was a rip-off game. I quit the game, took it apart, and found
nothing sexually explicit. The one CG I mentioned above is all there is to it.

[h1]Never buy this. I'm the only one who got scammed.[/h1]

column8:
这是个垃圾到底的XX，虚有其表的标题垃圾。
里面的东西都很有问题：开场就残血，我以为只是这样而已，直到费了点功夫打了怪买了药水，结果场景刷新就残血，搞残血锁定啊？行，我进战斗场面再啃，一两回还行的，第三回直接把药水给刷没了？！是的，就算你买多了，直接就没了看不见，又是残血锁定。   npc也是，对话一次就永久消失，看翻译的话是任务，但游戏系统的任务列表都没做出来；有些是商人或店家，这些都还算正常。有些宝箱放在一些根本去不了的地方（城镇右下角）。地图都是bug，大地图没地雷挺好的，就是个草稿，除了船有用；城镇地图有问题，房子里都是怪巢，锁残血下就是暴毙。
这个游戏就是个残废品，真就开局一张瑟图，还好意思打价钱？！免费给各位喷啦！！！！！！！
6块简直太贵了，不值得
column9:
This is utterly rubbish, a title that's all for show.
Everything in it is flawed: I start with low health, and I thought that was it, until I put in some effort to kill monsters and buy potions, only to find myself at low health when the scene refreshes. Low health lock? Okay, I'll just fight through it. It's fine for a couple of times, but the third time, I'm completely out of potions?! Yeah, even if you buy a lot, they're gone and invisible, and it's low health lock again. The same goes for NPCs. They disappear permanently after one conversation. The translation says they're quests, but the game system doesn't even have a quest list. Some are merchants or shops, which is fine. Some treasure chests are inaccessible (bottom right corner of town). The maps are buggy. The large map is good without mines, just a rough draft, except for the boat. The town map is buggy, with monster nests in every house, and you're dead when you're locked in at low health.
This game is a crappy product. It's really a gimmicky map at the start, and you still have the nerve to ask for a price?! Free rants from everyone!!!!!!! ! !
6 yuan is too expensive, not worth it

column8:
レベル20になるまでプレイしました。
開幕10分程度、一切進めかたが分からず、何度もゲームオーバーに会うため、
死にゲーとしての需要があるかもしれません。
しかし、攻略方法が分かった瞬間このゲームの全てを遊びつくすことが出来ます。

どこかにエンディングがあれば、私はこのゲームをオススメにしたかもしれません。
しかし私はエンディングを見つける事が出来ませんでした。

これからこのゲームをプレイするみなさんへ
広大なマップのどこかにダンジョンがあります。
そこの何らかイベントを見つけることを、このゲームのクリアと考えると良いでしょう。
column9:
I played until I reached level 20.
For the first 10 minutes or so, you have no idea how to progress and you'll encounter multiple game overs,
so there may be some demand for it as a death-defying game.
However, the moment you figure out how to beat the game, you'll be able to enjoy everything the game has to offer.

If there had been an ending somewhere, I might have recommended this game.
However, I was never able to find one.

To everyone thinking about playing this game:
Somewhere on the vast map is a dungeon.
Finding some kind of event there can be considered completing the game.

column8: An absolute masterpiece of game design. The worldbuilding, combat, soundtrack, graphical fidelity, and story are second to none. Before this game, I was lost in life and on the end of my rope. To think, that even briefly, pathetic games such as Nier:Automata, RE2, DMC5, Half-Life, and other such games were what I considered the industry standard. As of this moment, no more. I doubt there will ever be another game that captures me as so, or one that I will ever have the capacity to enjoy ever again. I truly believe the only game that comes close to this grand masterpiece is Bad Rats. And that is saying quite a lot.

column8:
Well, this game is strange. There are several reasons why I can not recommend this "game". I played as much of it as is possible. There is a main town that you can navigate around. Entering any building normally starts a fight. If your first move isn't to use magic and heal yourself; you will lose, always. You also should never use your actual magic attacks as you will need all the MP that you have until you can find/purchase more. Attacking is a bit cumbersome, but it still works. If you can save up the 2k currency; you are now fine. Purchase the gun from an NPC and wipe the floor with all remaining enemies. I found a problem shortly after clearing the town. You need to go other locations, but there is a glitch that removes the door sprite from your game. Just the sprite, if you can click on the tile that, you can go back to the town. I have a feeling that there is more to the game, but I can not figure out how (or who) to access it. 

Other problems include bad (or non-existing) translations, characters giving quests and then disappearing, a stark lack of things to actually interact with anywhere, and characters that are simply buggy.

Please do not purchase this game.

column8:
[u]DON'T waste your money on [b]Girl With a Big Sword {GWBS}[/b][/u] !! 
It is a broken RPG that is not worth the $0.54 US Sale price. 
There is a HINT that I should have noticed ==> 
There are exactly ZERO { 0 } Reviews & ZERO { 0 } Screenshots. 
Now certainly the Developer couldn't possibly have deleted ALL of them ?! Right ??

[h1][b][u]EDIT[/u]:[/b] Now a full 7 months after posting this Review, you may note on the Game Discussions/etc. page that there still exactly NO {i.e, 0 = Zero} reviews posted ...
Wonder whatever happened to THIS review ?? ... the World wonders { No; not correct - the World KNOWS !![/h1]

At the start, one may change the name of the Protagonist. However, the input is in a Cyrillic only alphabet Matrix. So use the Default name unless you are fluent in Russian.

The Protagonist {PC} begins combat with only 1 { one } of nominally 450 Health Points {HP} !!  One must expend ever disappearing Magic Points {MP} to Heal the PC BEFORE [u]every[/u] battle, just to be able to survive. 
Then when PC leaves the battle, HP drops back to 1 point again. 
AND the MP is not restored. AND Leveling up [u]does NOT restore[/u] either HP or MP.

Also, the [u]PC starts out Weaponless[/u]. AND [b]purchased weapons {Axe &/or Bow} cannot be equipped ![/b] 
Spells are the only effective offense, other than Fists :steamfacepalm: 
Perhaps it is intended that the PC uses only a Sword. But that is not made explicit AND [u][b]NO Swords[/b] are available[/u] in the early game.

Perhaps there is a way to fix this, but the Developer has stopped responding to Forum comments. AND the game lacks instructions { at least in English}. NPC's responses are either in broken English or Russian. 

It is not worth wasting my time to solve this; if that even is possible.

column8: This game is an experience that I genuinely recommend that everyone try. It is not good by any stretch of the imagination, but no other form of media, interactive or otherwise, has instilled such a profound sense of hollowness and disappointment within me. This game puts a curse on you. It holds nuggets of hope in front of your face, only to quickly knock them down and beat you over the head again. You find a way to heal, only to have your health reset back to one. It is well worth the 99 cents, if only for its unique ability to squash your enjoyment.

column8:
[h1] Genre [/h1] Ein JRPG

[h1] Gameplay [/h1] Wir können uns aussuchen ob wir einen Männlichen oder Weiblichen Charakter spielen wollen. Es macht keinen Großen Unterschied denn man startet mit 1 HP. Man kann sich (wenn man das Mädel spielt) via Heil Zauber heilen aber wenn man aus dem Menü rausgeht hat man automatisch wieder nur 1 HP. Potions kann man kaufen aber auch diese heilen nicht. Heisst man spielt dauerhaft mit einem HP. Zudem ist das Spiel kaum Übersetzt heisst die meisten Texte sind auf Russisch. Wenn man Häuser betritt startet automatisch ein Zufallskampf den man logischerweise sofort verliert. Selbst in den Screenshots des Spiels sieht man das der Charakter immer nur 1 HP hat. Musik gibt es außerhalb von Kämpfen auch keine. NPCs & Kisten verschwinden einfach so und man hat auch keine Start Waffe

[h1] Pro/Contra [/h1]
+ XBox 360 Controller Support

- Leider Keine Achievements
- Man startet mit 1 HP und heilen hat keine Wirkung (sobald man aus dem Menü rausgeht hat man wieder nur 1 HP)
- Sehr schlecht Übersetzt (Sehr viele Texte auf Russisch)
- Betritt man Häuser kommt sofort ein Zufallskampf den man natürlich aufgrund der Mangelnden HP sofort verliert
- Es gibt Keine Musik außerhalb von Kämpfen
- NPCs verschwinden nach dem Ansprechen
- Man hat Keine Waffe

[h1] Fazit [/h1] Eine unglaubliche Frechheit für sowas hier Geld zu verlangen. Das Spiel ist überhaupt nicht fertig. Man könnte das Spiel mit Patches in Ordnung bringen aber offensichtlich besteht wohl darin kein Interesse. Definitiv Nicht zu Empfehlen

column9:
[h1] Genre [/h1] A JRPG

[h1] Gameplay [/h1] We can choose whether we want to play a male or female character. It doesn't make much difference, as you start with 1 HP. You can heal yourself (if you're playing the female character) with healing spells, but when you exit the menu, you automatically have only 1 HP again. Potions can be purchased, but they don't heal. This means you play with one HP permanently. Furthermore, the game is barely translated, meaning most of the text is in Russian. When you enter houses, a random battle automatically starts, which you, logically, lose immediately. Even in the game screenshots, you can see that the character always only has 1 HP. There's no music outside of battles either. NPCs and crates simply disappear, and you don't have a starting weapon.

[h1] Pros/Cons [/h1]
+ Xbox 360 Controller Support

- Unfortunately, no achievements
- You start with 1 HP and healing has no effect (as soon as you exit the menu, you only have 1 HP again)
- Very poorly translated (a lot of text is in Russian)
- When you enter houses, a random battle immediately starts, which you immediately lose due to your lack of HP.
- There's no music outside of battles.
- NPCs disappear after being spoken to.
- You don't have a weapon.

[h1] Conclusion [/h1] It's incredibly impudent to charge for something like this. The game isn't finished at all. They could fix it with patches, but apparently there's no interest in doing so. Definitely Not Recommended

column8: I know what you're thinking, these other reviews have to be wrong, I'll give it a try and find out for myself. Well let me tell you about my experience... i load into the game and get asked if i was a men or a girl.. what ever.. small detail... get thrown into a town, with no clue about how to move or do anything.. okay what ever, i can figure things out... I then go to talk to someone which had poorly translated message, again, small detail... then after i click out of chat, they disappear... what? maybe they had no relevance to the game, so i continued on. i walked into the first building, and somehow stumbled into a battle, whatever, can't be too hard... except for the fact that i started the battle, my first battle, with 1 hp. i ended up one shotting the assassin with fire, not sure if it was a crit, but i'm not mad, leveled up, cool, maybe that'll heal me up. went into my second building, and found a bat, it killed me.. i got a game over... okay... i'll start over, yatta, yatta assassin, 1 hp, all that good stuff, and didn't go to bat house. i went to a third house, and got in a fight with an orc, die... game over... apparrently every house has a battle? didn't try them all, but i feel like that would have been a waste of time... don't buy this game, until you see all of this crap has been solved, this isn't even a game...

column8:
Girl with a big SWORD is one of a kind game, as the main character your duty is to solve the problems of a tormented town by accepting and fulfilling the requests of many of the unique and memorable NPCs in town.

Pros:
- NPCs won't repeat their dialogues and some may even disappear forever after talking to them, which makes a challenge to your memory abilities
- Upon entering homes you'll be facing an enemy while you're at 1 HP, to prove your survival skills
- World maps have at most one other area to explore, once you find it after going around it for like 30 minutes you'll feel a sense of accomplishment
- Some texts are written in broken English and even some others remain untranslated to give out that natural foreign world language experience
- Despite the title stating that the girl has a big SWORD she starts out with none, being this a metaphor that the sword was the adventures we lived through the game.

Cons:
- Needs more bare naked tiddy

column8:
Buggué à mort et injouable. Si les développeurs finissent le jeu il sera peut-être bon mais dans  l'état c'est nul.
Vous démarré avec votre personnage à 1 HP, vous avez un sort de soin et vous pouvez vous soigner mais dès que vous rentréez dans une maison votre vie retombe à 1, et dès que vous rentrez dans une maison vous engagez un combat :/
column9:
Deadly buggy and unplayable. If the developers finish the game, it might be good, but as it stands, it sucks.
You start with your character at 1 HP. You have a healing spell and you can heal yourself, but as soon as you enter a house, your HP drops back to 1, and as soon as you enter a house, you engage in combat :/

column8: so this game needs WORK! massive mess up on the laguage translations (suggest finding someone who is fluent in english and russian to translate). i understand the context of how she got there, being injured and needing to go to a nearby town, but restting health to 1 every time you leave or enter a house or go from one zone to the next is insane. character creation screen is locked so that you cant change the name, plus its in, idk what language. not too much to do in the main town, few little find this item type quests, but thats it. no clear objecctive to the game. also, upon leaving town, there is no monsters of any kind nor is there any other villages aside from a single cave where you get a specific item. the boats are a really neat touch, the music aint bad, and its  movement system is ALMOST fluid enough to be decent. this game has a good bit of potential. put some work in it and i KNOW you guys can turn it into to something great! im goin to check back in on it in about a month or so and see how you guys have progressed. im hoping yall improve it some! i really want to be able to recommend this game to my friends! its got a really nostalgic feel to it. so it needs work but i know you guys can make something that we would all want to come back to!

column8: I wish I had read the reviews before paying for this. It's $2 more than it's worth and it only costs $1.19. It was not made in English, which is fine, but it is not properly translated to English afterward. The game is not complete. Many glitches occur within the first seconds of the game. Treasure chests and people disappear. There is an unending loop in the building on the right where you kill the orc and immediately start another fight. You can't get past it.

column8:
このゲームはエターなっている──私は直感した。
スイッチが配置されていないオブジェクト、フィールドと地獄を繋ぐ木の扉、民家で待ち構えているモンスター達…その全てに意味があるとは到底思えなかった。
しかしながらこのゲームは、常識や良識にとらわれる事無く作者が表現したかったものがそのまま形になったとも考えられる。
これも多様性のひとつとして受け取るべきだろう。
でも会話するたびにHPが1になるのはメッセージ性強すぎだょ＞＜
column9:
I had a hunch that this game was eternal.
The objects with no switches, the wooden door connecting the field to Hell, the monsters waiting in private homes... none of it seemed to have any meaning.
However, this game can also be seen as a direct manifestation of what the author wanted to express, without being bound by common sense or good judgment.
This should also be seen as an example of diversity.
But having your HP go down to 1 every time you talk is too strong a message ><

column8:
After playing the game for a few mins. I closed it and told myself WTF. Anyways I think the game is not completed yet and I think there are bugs like you go inside the house and you find yourself in the worldmap or fighting a monster with your character that has "1" hp,
and some NPC's Disappear after talking to them. Some words are not translated to english, like speaking to the inn girl if it
really was an inn, and the green chest conversation. There is no tutorial or clear objective on what to do in the game. you get no starting money and weapon. You get an Axe from the silver chest (lol) for choppping small trees. (Not for fighting monsters.)


Expectaion in the future update:
Tutorial (If its a unique kind of RPG. cuz I dont see often in RPG that you go inside a house then find yourself in the world map lol)
Please fix the bugs developers.
I would like some "QUEST" category in the options.
If the Character really has "1" hp make a short intro/story/explanation why the character has "1" hp.
Im looking forward to this game.

column8: В  игре никто не умирает. В начале боя  жмем магию лечения, восстанавливаем здоровье и всех побеждаем. Умереть невозможно. Только в 1 доме полезли нескончаемые орки, как тараканы. Я их била около получаса, прокачалась до 25 уровня, а они не кончаются. Надоело и я выключила игру, теперь буду играть с последнего сохранения.  Может кто знает, что это за бесконечные орки? Так поиграть можно, но если опять бить нескончаемых орков(кнопка побег не работает), то ну ее на фиг. И еще то-ли это баг со вторым демоном на остовах, я не поняла. Я нашла дверь в пустыне, взяла сундук, а этот голубенький сундучок тут-же исчез, хотя у меня 10 отмычек и 1 ключ. Далее у меня в предметах ( именно в предметах, где все зелья) был пистолет, я на него нажала, и он исчез. Что все это значит, непонятно. Что отдавать 2-му демону тоже.  Кто разобрался, отпишитесь в комментариях.После патча решила еще сыгрануть. Орки убрались, все остальное осталось. Найденный пистолет, он дает + 250 атаки, одеть нельзя. Пришлось его продать дешевле, чтобы его-же и купить, но дороже и только тогда можно одеть. Теперь и с первым демоном проблема, меч пропал вместе с сундуком. До патча этот квест сдавался. Описания что какой-либо предмет дает герою нет. И очень много недоделок. Самое смешное, что девочка с большим мечом, изначально вообще без оружия. Это не игра, а баг на баге. Хотела дать игре шанс, но этого больного спасти нельзя. Меняю обзор на отрицательный.
column9: No one dies in the game. At the start of the battle, press healing magic, restore health, and defeat everyone. It's impossible to die. Only in one house did endless orcs start crawling around like cockroaches. I spent about half an hour fighting them, leveled up to level 25, and they still wouldn't end. I got tired of it and turned the game off; now I'll play from the last save. Does anyone know what these endless orcs are? It's playable, but if you keep fighting endless orcs (the escape button doesn't work), then screw it. Also, maybe it's a bug with the second demon on the wrecks, I don't understand. I found a door in the desert, picked up a chest, and the little blue chest immediately disappeared, even though I had 10 lockpicks and 1 key. Then, in my inventory (specifically, in the inventory where all the potions are), I had a pistol; I clicked on it, and it disappeared. I don't understand what all this means. What to give to the second demon, too. If anyone figured it out, please post in the comments. After the patch, I decided to play again. The orcs were gone, but everything else remained. I found a pistol, it gives +250 attack, but it can't be equipped. I had to sell it for less so I could buy the same one, but at a higher price, and only then can I equip it. Now I'm having trouble with the first demon too: the sword disappeared along with the chest. This quest was completed before the patch. There's no description of what the hero gains from any item. And there are a lot of flaws. The funniest thing is that the girl with the big sword initially has no weapon at all. This isn't a game, it's a bug after a bug. I wanted to give the game a chance, but this sick creature can't be saved. I'm changing my review to negative.

column8: Это какой-то кошмарный кошмар. Это не игра, а тяп-ляп в мейкере мв за 10 минут. Просто поверьте, это - не игра. Персонаж всё время умирает, всё залаговано, никаких квестов, никаких идей, просто стандартная карта из мв, стандартные персонажи и странно-глупые диалоги. Играть в это невозможно, а самое главное : не надо. Музыки в игре нет от слова совсем. Наверное, чтобы насладиться ОРИГИНАЛЬНЫМ саундтреком, надо его ещё и купить :С
column9: This is a complete nightmare. This isn't a game, it's a 10-minute hack-and-slash MW Maker hack. Trust me, this isn't a game. Characters die all the time, everything is laggy, there are no quests, no ideas, just a standard MW map, standard characters, and weirdly stupid dialogue. It's impossible to play, and most importantly: you shouldn't. There's absolutely no music in the game. You probably have to buy the ORIGINAL soundtrack to enjoy it. :C

column8:
Starting the game on a windows-machine had been difficult, because at first the antivirus-software fund FileRepMalware in the game.exe
After starting the game you could chose your Charakter. That's simple, but okay.
You get into a town, but you start with 1/400 HP and no coins. Which make it quiet difficult to fight. Even if you can heal yourself with a magic spell (in case you chose the woman). When you return from fight to the "traveling world" your Healthpoints get set back to 1/400. 
The same problem is on al Linux machine.
Another unplausible behaviour are the NPC's, you could talk to them once and then they disappear immediatly. 
There need to be an update, so the game is playable!!!
